title.native: わがまま☆フェアリー ミルモでポン!

description:
Kaede is a cheerful and energetic eighth grader. When it comes to boys, however, she is hopelessly shy.

One day, on her way home from school, Kaede walks into a mysterious shop and buys a colorful cocoa mug. When she reaches home, she casually peeks into the bottom of the mug and discovers an engraved note, which says, "If you read this message aloud while pouring hot cocoa into the mug, a love fairy ("muglox") will appear and grant your every wish." The skeptical but curious Kaede follows the directions and announces her wish to date Yuuki, the class heartthrob. Suddenly, the adorable blue Mirumo appears! We soon find out, however, that this cute little muglox would rather eat chocolate and create mischief than help Kaede.

Mirumo, it seems, is prince of the muglox world. Horrified at the prospect of having to marry Rirumu, his princess bride-to-be, Mirumo has escaped the muglox world. Hot on his heels, however, are Rirumu, Yashichi the bounty hunter, and a cast of hundreds of muglox ranging from the good to the bad to the nutty. This gang of adorable troublemakers will see to it that school life for Kaede and her friends is never the same...

(Source: mirmo-zibang)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

**Non-Anime Roles:**
- Irene - Arknights (VG)
- Unknown God - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Kiana Kaslana - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
- Luna - Punishing: Gray Raven (VG)
- Vesti - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- iDoll Ocean - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Haruka Sawamura - Yakuza Series (VG)
- Vena - TEVI (VG)
- Fukayama Ayane - Nogizaka Haruka no Himitsu: Cosplay, Hajimemashita (VN)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](http://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=68) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mai__nakahara) | [Wiki](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mai_Nakahara)

A voice actress and singer.

**Non-Anime Roles:**
• Seele Vollerei - Honkai Impact 3rd, Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
• Kaavi - Mahjong Soul (VG)
• Hiyori Tsuchinaga - Blue Archive (VG) 
• Cantarella - Wuthering Waves (VG)
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiromug)

**[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cunepero)**

Kojima got started in the industry one day while he was working as a freelancer in various industries and somehow ended up with a job in anime at the age of 23.

His first project was on the show "[Shima Shima Tora no Shimajirou](https://anilist.co/anime/9768/Shima-Shima-Tora-no-Shimajirou/)" under [Studio Kikan](https://anilist.co/studio/256/Studio-Kikan), where he got started of by doing in-between animation. At the time he was very unexperienced with anime production and has [said](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he likely would have been fired for his lack of knowledge and poor quality work, if not for the in-between animation checker teaching him everything from scratch.

Later down the line after establishing himself more in the anime industry, he would go on to work on "[Gurren Lagann](https://anilist.co/anime/2001/Tengen-Toppa-Gurren-Lagann/)" as a challenge to himself, where he would put forth mecha and effects animation he had no idea how to prior.

Kojima [states](https://www.arabnews.jp/article/arts-culture/article_26145/) he feels a lot of inspiration from manga artists who are able to think about a story, break it up into panels, and express it in pictures. He has thought about drawing a manga himself, even if it's something simple.

Some of his favorite anime are "[Inital D](https://anilist.co/anime/185/Initial-D/)," "[Natsume's Book of Friends](https://anilist.co/anime/4081/Natsume-Yuujinchou/)," "[Re:ZERO -Starting Life in Another World-](https://anilist.co/anime/21355/ReZero-kara-Hajimeru-Isekai-Seikatsu/)," "[Neon Genesis Evangelion](https://anilist.co/anime/30/Shin-Seiki-Evangelion/)," "[A KITE](https://anilist.co/anime/320/A-KITE/)," "[JIN-ROH](https://anilist.co/anime/570/JINROH/)," "[FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/)" and "[Doukyuusei -Classmates-](https://anilist.co/anime/21096/Doukyuusei/)."

Some of his favorite manga are "[HI Score Girl](https://anilist.co/manga/74501/Hi-Score-Girl/)" and "[A White Rose in Bloom](https://anilist.co/manga/108360/Mejirobana-no-Saku/)."
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/カサヰケンイチ)

edges.role: Episode Director (OP2, OP3, ED2, ED3, eps 1, 35, 74)

node.description: [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/カサヰケンイチ)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/589238508)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/), currently affiliated with [CloverWorks](https://anilist.co/studio/6222/CloverWorks).

__[Profile (Imagine)](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/10)__

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takayuki Negishi__ is a Japanese guitarist, composer, arranger and music producer affiliated with Imagine Music, better known for his composition work on several anime, such as; the hit magical girl TV series Cardcaptor Sakura, Tokyo Mew Mew and Mnemosyne. He began working in the industry as a synthesizer operator in 1983, before he later became a composer. He also produces music for several  artists like Mariko Nagai and Hiroko Moriguchi.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.

edges.role: Theme Song Arrangement (OP1, OP3, ED1, ED4, ED6)

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cher_vOwO)

__Cher Watanabe__ is a Japanese musician, composer, arranger and keyboardist.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/222835/)._
_Note: Not to be confused with the [producer](https://anilist.co/staff/222835/)._
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/うえだひでひと)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/numa_milky)

Numata is best known for his strongly distorted character style and peculiar sense for timing, often being named as an animator of the [Kanada](https://anilist.co/staff/106398/) school. He tends to work together with character designer [Kyuuta Sakai](https://anilist.co/staff/106111/), whose disproportionated character designs particularly fit his style, employing often large teardrops, which brought him to spotlight in [Higurashi no Naku Koro ni](https://anilist.co/anime/934/). The duo also participated together in several other shows, such as [Ichigo Mashimaro](https://anilist.co/anime/488/) and [Strawberry Panic](https://anilist.co/anime/855/).

Every now and then works under one of his many pseudonyms.

(Source: Anidb)

[Profile](https://web.archive.org/web/20211123063650/http://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/member.php?mem=w46) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/hitomi-215/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hitomityan) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%81%B2%E3%81%A8%E7%BE%8E)

She is a voice actress married to fellow voice actor [Kazuya Ichijou](https://anilist.co/staff/96519). She is also a good friend of fellow voice actress [Yuu Amamiya](https://anilist.co/staff/96273).
Not to be confused with two singers, one of whom also goes by "hitomi" and the other, "Hitomi".

(Source: Wikipedia)
**Becky** is a popular Japanese presenter and *tarento*.
[Profile](http://little-portal.com/profile/kozakura-etsuko/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/alittlealittle) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kozaetu/)
[Website](http://www.nanriyuuka.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tokuchan777)

Yukitoshi Tokumoto is a Japanese Actor and Voice Actor.

Giorgio Vincenzo Vanni is an Italian singer and song-writer.  Vanni is well known for performing theme songs of Italian dubs of Japanese and American animated TV series.   The dubbed Italian songs he sings usually are not covers of the Japanese songs but tend to be newly written songs for the Italian dub of the anime.   (Source: Wikipedia)
